title: Google SheetsFont Characteristics

metadata.description: Learn about Google SheetsFont Characteristics with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Font Characteristics
You can apply different characteristics to fonts such as:
Bold
Italic
Underlined
Strike though
The commands can be found below in the
Format
menu or on the
Quick Access Toolbar
:
Bold
is applied by either clicking the Bold (
) icon in the Ribbon or using the keyboard shortcut
Ctrl+B
or
Command+B
Italic
is applied by either clicking the Italic (
) icon in the Ribbon or using the keyboard shortcut
Ctrl+I
or
Command+I
Underline
is applied by either clicking the Underline (
) option in the
Format
menu or using the keyboard shortcut
Ctrl+U
or
Command+U
Strikethrough
is applied by either clicking the Strikethrough (
) icon in the Ribbon or using the keyboard shortcut
Alt+Shift+5
or
Option+Shift+5
Example
The image below shows different font characteristics for both text and numbers:

★
+1

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this c feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers Google SheetsFont Characteristics concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Google SheetsFont Characteristics effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Google SheetsFont Characteristics and how to apply it in your projects.
